intro: Impatiens pseudokingii, commonly known as the Sierra Leone impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Sierra Leone. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of pink and white. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. It is often found growing in the understory of dense forests, where it relies on the canopy for light. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
